intro: Minuartia kabylica, commonly known as the Kabylian rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms dense mats on rocky or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers with four petals, characteristic of the mustard family. It is native to the Balkans, particularly found in regions of Albania and Kosovo. Minuartia kabylica is adapted to harsh, sunny environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine zones.
